m_szDocSumamry: Comments A tire (American English) or tyre (British English) is a ring-shaped vehicle component that covers the wheelâ€™s rim to protect it and enable better vehicle performance. Most tyres, such as those for automobiles and bicycles, provide traction between the vehicle and the road while providing a flexible cushion that absorbs shock. The materials of modern pneumatic tyres are synthetic rubber, natural rubber, fabric and wire, along with carbon black and other chemical compounds. They consist of a tread and a body.
